newsitem.title: USA: KCBT wheat ends mostly lower on late spec selling.
newsitem.headline: KCBT wheat ends mostly lower on late spec selling.

text.p: KCBT wheat futures closed mostly lower on a late speculative selloff tied to a dip from the day's highs in CBOT soy complex futures, traders said.
Sharp gains most of the day in soy complex futures stemmed from USDA's correction early Tuesday in its March 1 U.S. soybean ending stocks figure, CBOT traders said.
USDA said March 1 soybean stocks totaled 1,055,607,000 bushels and not 1,077,587,000 bushels it had reported on Monday. USDA cited a computational error.
However, late in the session, CBOT soy futures slipped from the highs, and other commodity values including KCBT wheat slipped as well, KCBT traders said.
Refco Inc and E.D. and F. Man were late sellers of one million bushels in the May contract and Rosenthal Collins sole one million bushels of the July, traders said.
Overall good crop conditions in the U.S. Great Plains hard red winter wheat region lent pressure, sources said.
KCBT hard red winter wheat closed 3-3/4 cents per bushel lower to 1/4 up, with May down 3-3/4 at $4.18-3/4.
